thread.title: Comment on Everton Vs Man United‎: Talk Big & Win Your Club’s Jersey by priscilla evans
thread.title_full: Comment on Everton Vs Man United‎: Talk Big & Win Your Club’s Jersey by priscilla evans

author: priscilla evans
title: Comment on Everton Vs Man United‎: Talk Big & Win Your Club’s Jersey by priscilla evans
text:
Headlines , Top Features 
The leagues across the world resume this weekend after the international break, and in England there abound interesting fallouts. Teams will hope to have a fully fit squad after their players’ international duties, in view of dangers of injuries and burnouts. 
At the Goodison Park on Saturday, 7th placed Everton will welcome 3rd placed Manchester United. 
The match billed to kick off at 3pm, Nigerian time, will be a tough test for both teams. 
United will want to get a victory and wish their city rivals in Manchester and Arsenal falter. 
As for Everton, the aim is to climb some steps further up the table. 
So what do you expect from this game? Who are the players to make the difference in the game? Can former Everton boy, Wayne Rooney play with utmost inspiration to lead Manchester United to a convincing victory? 
Do you think Everton will inflict another defeat on Louis van Gaal’s side or will the Red Devils prove to be too strong for the Merseysiders? 
In this latest Completesportsnigeria.com/Zenith Sports Talk Big & Win It!, we want you our dear reader to send in your views and opinions on what you feel will be the outcome of this big game. 
In each edition of this exercise, Completesportsnigeria.com’s in-house judges’ decisions are final. 
We are looking for outstanding posts based on the originality of content, uniqueness of opinion/verdict from a fan’s point of view. 
A correct prediction of the big match’s scoreline could also increase a post’s chances of being selected for prize. 
Each of the two top winners selected every week wins his/her club’s authentic shirt. Another two readers will receive one face-cap each, as consolation prizes. 
Write at least one full paragraph comment (preview) on this match through the “Leave A Reply” field at the bottom of this page. Enter your authentic email address in the required field before posting your comment/preview. 
Don’t copy and paste online stories/articles here as that will not be approved for winners’ selection.Write your full names and location at the bottom of your comment/preview (eg: Janet Samuel, Gboko, Benue State ) ‎
